item.description:
Getting rained on doesn't sound fun (especially with a chance of thunderstorms) - so we're skipping Recess and heading to JP for brunch! Join us even if you weren't planning to be at Recess for Justice. Arrive by yourself or bring your hungry friends!

RSVP so we have an accurate head count for the restaurant.

JP Seafood serves traditional American breakfast dishes PLUS you can choose from their sushi menu. Including lots of vegan/vegetarian options. From personal experience and based on reviews like this one we know you're going to enjoy it!

Look no further if you're seeking like-minded folks to share a side of pancakes with, want to cross-promote your events and campaigns while enjoying omelets or savoring sushi, or are new to the area and looking for groups to get involved in. If you want to build a strong cross-issue social justice movement, SoJust is for you!

Free parking is available behind the restaurant or across the street in the lot behind the liquor store. Nearest T stop is Green Street on the Orange line. Bus route: 39

_________________________________________________________

SOCIALIZING FOR JUSTICE - www.sojust.org
SoJust is all about building a cross-issue progressive community, network and movement in Boston. We're doing it by putting the SOCIAL back in SOCIAL JUSTICE. We focus on creating welcoming spaces that foster relationship-building across issue silos.

SoJust isn't a non-profit 501(c)(3). We're a grassroots volunteer-run member-supported cross-issue progressive community that's been growing steadily since August 2006. We have over 1750 members, we've hosted 95+ events and we manage an online hub of progressive events and resources at www.sojust.org. If you've benefited from this cross-issue progressive network please contribute the suggested annual membership fee of $25. You may do this online or at any of our events. Thank you for helping us continue to provide a space for like-minded progressives of all stripes.

Want to know more about SoJust? Check out our Frequently Asked Questions and past event photos!
item.name: Brunch for Justice (Recess Cancelled)
